page.title: 02Draycott in the Clay housing
page.content:
The housing in{Draycott in the Clay } ranges from small terraced cottages to large farmhouses and executive style houses. The village has a council estate of 20 to 30 properties and a private estate which is slightly larger. Over the past few years many of the council houses have been purchased by their occupiers. The area is not on mains gas, most houses use either oil or solid fuel for heating. Some of the older farms were built about A.D. 1700.
Recently a number of houses which were formerly part of an army camp, and empty for many years, have been rennovated and are now occupied. {A typical 4 bedroom detached house in {the village would cost about Â£45,000, {but other properties are available {from as little as Â£15,000.
